From: "Rick_Muller" <rpmuller@...>
Subject: Use of Cantera for chemistry of weakly ionized gas?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=270018455; y=MM43YLOCukGsWy4QblCPz6Yeh0lDmJMs3t5LUrkK6DAy7ckxeaQ
X-Yahoo-Profile: Rick_Muller

I'm interested in whether anyone is using Cantera to simulate reactions
of =
ionized species such as would occur in a weakly ionized gas. It
seems to me=
 that one could augment the normal kinetics that come out
of a GRI reaction=
 mechanism with a Saha equation calculation of the
ionization process. Howe=
ver, this would require that electrons be
treated as actual species in the =
reaction mechanism, and I don't know
whether there are serious problems in =
doing this. Can anyone comment
on the suitability of this type of a model?
=

Thanks in advance,

Rick Muller
